meanings.definition: The lowest point or part of something.
meanings.sent1: I found a shiny rock at the bottom of the river.
meanings.sent2: The cat sat at the bottom of the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The bottom of the cookie jar was a treasure trove of crumbs.
meanings.sent4: His spirits hit rock bottom after losing the game.
meanings.sent5: The bottom of the well seemed like a mysterious abyss.

meanings.definition: The underside or lower surface of something.
meanings.sent1: The boat's bottom was painted blue.
meanings.sent2: She placed the book on the bottom shelf.
meanings.sent3: The bottom of the plate was covered in sauce.
meanings.sent4: The bottom of the cloud looked fluffy and white.
meanings.sent5: The bottom of the shoe had a worn-out sole.

meanings.definition: The seat of a chair or other piece of furniture.
meanings.sent1: He sat on the comfortable bottom of the armchair.
meanings.sent2: The bottom of the stool was cushioned for extra comfort.
meanings.sent3: The cat claimed the bottom of the couch as its favorite spot.
meanings.sent4: The bottom of the swing creaked as she sat down.
meanings.sent5: The bottom of the rocking chair moved gently back and forth.

meanings.definition: The lowest rank or position in a hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: She started at the bottom of the company and worked her way up.
meanings.sent2: The bottom of the class received extra help from the teacher.
meanings.sent3: Being at the bottom of the team didn't discourage him.
meanings.sent4: The bottom of the social ladder can be challenging to climb.
meanings.sent5: The bottom of the pyramid scheme felt the most pressure.

meanings.definition: The end or last part of something.
meanings.sent1: At the bottom of the page, there was a small illustration.
meanings.sent2: The bottom of the list contained the final item.
meanings.sent3: The bottom of the movie had a surprising plot twist.
meanings.sent4: The bottom of the bag held a hidden surprise.
meanings.sent5: The bottom of the mountain trail was the most challenging part.
